source.47258ad2:
# Code
This section is for coding :) Suggested 180 minutes
source.9476d581:
# Rubric
Requirement Description Points Earned
Originality All code is your own. Any code that is not your own is properly cited. 5 points
Planning The "make a plan" section includes a detailed description of how you plan to complete the project, including some pseudocode 10 points
Idea Your idea is original, interesting, and makes sense as a single program 10 points
Compiles Code compiles without error(s) 10 points
Requirements Each requirement is met. 50 points
Comments Code is properly commented 5 points
Feedback Peer feedback is taken into consideration. Changes are made based on feedback. 5 points
Reflection Reflection is thoughtful and answers all required questions 5 points
The project is out of 100 points. Up to 5 points extra credit. --- "Final" Score: ---
source.a6914242:
## Skill Set Mastery

---

If statements, For Loops, While Loops, Functions, Functions with Return Values, Counters, Nested Control Structures, Comments and Documentation, Testing

---

Could also show mastery of: Provide Feedback, Software Development Life Cycle, Creativity and Innovation, Critical Thinking and Problem Solving, Design Planning, Finding Resources, Providing Feedback, Print Statments, User Input, Mathematical Operators, String Operators,
source.7fa51769: Who did you give feedback to?
source.be98cc03: Create a plan using the planning document provided in class and linked into the Canvas assignment. You may transfer the plan into your kaggle notebook if you would like, but this is not required.
source.c5ea1c57:
# Project Instructions
In this project, you will demonstrate your understanding of unit 1 concepts with a project of your choice (SFW). Your project must:
* Include at least one if statement
* Include at least one for loop 
* Include at least one while loop
* Include at least one nested control structure
* Include at least one counter / iterator / accumulator
* Include at least one function with a return value
* Any reused code is organized into functions
source.b08a5ec1:

Type your name here
source.d8323e7e:
Here, write a 1 paragraph reflection answering the following questions:

* How did you come up with your idea?
* What was the hardest part of this project?
* What was the easiesy part of this project?
* How did you utilize your peer feedback?
* What was different between your plan and the final project?
* How well did you plan? Was your idea too easy? Too hard? Just right?
* If you had unlimited time, what would you add to this project?
